title: 14 things to know about the Chick-fil-A that opened today in Portage
text:
14 things to know about the Chick-fil-A that opened today in Portage Updated February 23, 2017 Comment Portage welcomes the investment 
Chick-fil-A spent at least $1.7 million to build its fifth location in Michigan and make improvements at its site in front of Southland Mall. “The City of Portage is grateful to Chick-fil-A for investing in Portage,” said Mayor Peter Strazdas said of the restaurant. “The more the merrier,” he said of growing businesses in the county’s largest retail corridor. "I think that we have created a culture and a district -- a very busy thoroughfare and business district -- that is very inviting. And it’s no surprise we have more businesses who want to come to South Westnedge.” Mark Bugnaski | MLive.com Traffic is a big concern as things get started 
As a result of the Feb. 23, opening, the city of Portage was prepared to see traffic volume rise on the already busy South Westnedge Avenue in front of Southland Mall on Feb. 23, 24 and 25. Portage Public Safety, the city’s traffic engineer and others have worked for the past four weeks to craft a plan to to ease the traffic flow and avoid trouble on South Westnedge Avenue. Google Maps The franchise owner has local connections 
Franchise operator Idris Rashid, 41, is a native of Pontiac, but he is a graduate of Western Michigan University who said the Kalamazoo area is like a second home to him. Rashid has a bachelor's degree in business administration (2001) and a master's degree in organizational leadership (2002), both from WMU. While here, he also worked in the Kalamazoo Public Schools as a behavior specialist and, in a separate assignment, he trained KPS teachers to use new technology. Mark Bugnaski | MLive.com Chicken is the thing 
The restaurant group prides itself on its boneless chicken sandwiches and other fare. They include its: Chicken Sandwich Deluxe; Chick-fil-A Nuggets, Chick-n-Strips and Chicken Salad Sandwich. Shwon here is its Spicy Chicken Sandwich. Mark Bugnaski | MLive.com But more than chicken is on the menu 
With health-conscious consumers looking for healthy options, the restaurant group has been marketing salads and fare such as its Egg White Grill, a sandwich on an English muffin, and its Chick-fil-A Spicy Southwest Salad, a salad entre topped with spicy grilled chicken, roasted corn, black beans and pepitas. Shown here is its Kale and Broccolini, two leafy greens in a sweet and tangy maple vinaigrette dressing, topped with dried sour cherries. Mark Bugnaski | MLive.com
